page.title: 06THE CAVENDISHES-HOLKER MOSS
page.content: Much of the Furness area,including Holker Moss,is owned by the {Cavendishes,}who rent out the land to tenant farmers. In the early 17th century a family called the{Prestons}owned{Holker Hall. The land on which it was built was owned by{Cartmel Priory.}Richard Preston who was Prior at Cartmel continued to farm the surrounding land after 1536.In 1640 Thomas Preston had his estates sequestrated by Parliament for his royalism.However he recovered them for a sum of Â£1592.Shortly after this time the male line of the Prestons became extinct.The{Lowthers} then took hold of both the Hall and its estates.They in turn handed the establishment down to the{Cavendishes. The Cavendish family is connected with local events like the popular{Lakeland {Rose Show}held on the estate in July.
